title: Find Customer Referee
subject: SQL
setupCode: CREATE TABLE Customer (id int, name varchar(25), referee_id int); INSERT INTO Customer (id, name, referee_id) VALUES (1, 'Will', NULL), (2, 'Jane', NULL), (3, 'Alex', 2), (4, 'Bill', NULL), (5, 'Zack', 1), (6, 'Mark', 2);

title: Big Countries
starterCode: SELECT name, population, area FROM World WHERE ...
subject: SQL
setupCode: CREATE TABLE World (name varchar(255), continent varchar(255), area int, population int, gdp bigint); INSERT INTO World (name, continent, area, population, gdp) VALUES ('Afghanistan', 'Asia', 652230, 25500100, 20343000000), ('Albania', 'Europe', 28748, 2831741, 12960000000), ('Algeria', 'Africa', 2381741, 37100000, 188681000000), ('Andorra', 'Europe', 468, 78115, 3712000000), ('Angola', 'Africa', 1246700, 20609294, 100990000000);

title: Article Views I
starterCode: SELECT DISTINCT author_id AS id FROM Views WHERE ...
subject: SQL
setupCode: CREATE TABLE Views (article_id int, author_id int, viewer_id int, view_date date); INSERT INTO Views (article_id, author_id, viewer_id, view_date) VALUES (1, 3, 5, '2019-08-01'), (1, 3, 6, '2019-08-02'), (2, 7, 7, '2019-08-01'), (2, 7, 6, '2019-08-02'), (4, 7, 1, '2019-07-22'), (3, 4, 4, '2019-07-21'), (3, 4, 4, '2019-07-21');

title: Invalid Tweets
starterCode: SELECT tweet_id FROM Tweets WHERE LENGTH(content) ...
subject: SQL
setupCode: CREATE TABLE Tweets (tweet_id int, content varchar(50)); INSERT INTO Tweets (tweet_id, content) VALUES (1, 'Vote for Biden'), (2, 'Let us make America great again!');

title: Create Table with PK
subject: DBMS
description: Create a table 'users' with 'id' as PRIMARY KEY and 'name' as TEXT. Insert (1, 'Alice'). Select *.

title: Create Table with FK
subject: DBMS
description: Create table 'orders' with 'user_id' referencing 'users(id)'. Insert valid data. Select *. (Assume users table exists with id 1).
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users; CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY); INSERT INTO users VALUES (1);

title: Unique Constraint
subject: DBMS
description: Create table 'emails' with 'email' TEXT UNIQUE. Insert 'a@b.com' twice (ignore error). Select count(*).

title: Not Null Constraint
subject: DBMS
description: Create table 'items' with 'name' TEXT NOT NULL. Try inserting NULL (ignore error). Select count(*).

title: Check Constraint
subject: DBMS
description: Create table 'age' with 'val' INT CHECK(val >= 18). Insert 17 (ignore error). Select count(*).

title: Default Value
subject: DBMS
description: Create table 'status' with 'active' INT DEFAULT 1. Insert default. Select active.

title: Composite PK
subject: DBMS
description: Create table 'enroll' with (sid, cid) as PRIMARY KEY. Insert (1, 101). Select *.

title: Alter Add Column
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users; CREATE TABLE users (id INT, name TEXT); INSERT INTO users VALUES (1, 'Alice');

title: Drop Table
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS temp; CREATE TABLE temp (id INT);

title: Truncate Table
subject: DBMS
description: Delete all rows from 'logs'. (SQLite uses DELETE FROM).
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS logs; CREATE TABLE logs (msg TEXT); INSERT INTO logs VALUES ('Error');

title: Update with Where
subject: DBMS
description: Update 'users' set name='Bob' where id=1. Select name.
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users; CREATE TABLE users (id INT, name TEXT); INSERT INTO users VALUES (1, 'Alice');

title: Delete with Where
subject: DBMS
description: Delete from 'users' where id=1. Select count(*).
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users; CREATE TABLE users (id INT PRIMARY KEY, role TEXT DEFAULT 'user');
INSERT INTO users (id) VALUES (1);

title: Select Distinct
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS employees; CREATE TABLE employees (dept TEXT); INSERT INTO employees VALUES ('HR'), ('HR'), ('IT');

title: Order By
subject: DBMS
description: Select names ordered by age desc.
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users; CREATE TABLE users (name TEXT, age INT); INSERT INTO users VALUES ('Alice', 20), ('Bob', 30);

title: Group By Count
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users; CREATE TABLE users (country TEXT); INSERT INTO users VALUES ('IN'), ('IN'), ('US');

title: Having Clause
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users; CREATE TABLE users (country TEXT); INSERT INTO users VALUES ('IN'), ('IN'), ('US');

title: Inner Join
subject: DBMS
description: Join users and orders on user_id. Select user name and order id.

title: Left Join
subject: DBMS
description: Left join users and orders. Select user name and order id.
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users; DROP TABLE IF EXISTS orders; CREATE TABLE users (id INT, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE orders (id INT, user_id INT);
INSERT INTO users VALUES (1, 'Alice'), (2, 'Bob'); INSERT INTO orders VALUES (101, 1);

title: Union
subject: DBMS
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS A; DROP TABLE IF EXISTS B; CREATE TABLE A (val INT); CREATE TABLE B (val INT);
INSERT INTO A VALUES (1); INSERT INTO B VALUES (2);

title: Intersect
subject: DBMS
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS A; DROP TABLE IF EXISTS B; CREATE TABLE A (val INT); CREATE TABLE B (val INT);
INSERT INTO A VALUES (1), (2); INSERT INTO B VALUES (1), (3);

title: Except
subject: DBMS
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS A; DROP TABLE IF EXISTS B; CREATE TABLE A (val INT); CREATE TABLE B (val INT);
INSERT INTO A VALUES (1), (2); INSERT INTO B VALUES (1);

title: Subquery
subject: DBMS
description: Select name where id in (select user_id from orders).
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users; DROP TABLE IF EXISTS orders; CREATE TABLE users (id INT, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE orders (user_id INT);
INSERT INTO users VALUES (1, 'Alice'), (2, 'Bob'); INSERT INTO orders VALUES (1);

title: Exists
subject: DBMS
description: Select name where exists order for user.
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users; DROP TABLE IF EXISTS orders; CREATE TABLE users (id INT, name TEXT); CREATE TABLE orders (user_id INT);
INSERT INTO users VALUES (1, 'Alice'), (2, 'Bob'); INSERT INTO orders VALUES (1);

title: Create View
subject: DBMS
description: Create view 'v_users' as select name from users. Select * from v_users.
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users; CREATE TABLE users (name TEXT); INSERT INTO users VALUES ('Alice');

title: Create Index
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users; CREATE TABLE users (email TEXT);

title: Transaction Commit
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT);

title: Transaction Rollback
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT);

title: Grant (Mocked)
subject: DBMS
description: Grant SELECT on T to user. (SQLite doesn't support GRANT, just mock SELECT 'Granted').
hint: GRANT SELECT ON T TO user

title: Revoke (Mocked)
subject: DBMS
description: Revoke SELECT on T from user. (Mocked).
hint: REVOKE SELECT ON T FROM user

subject: DBMS

-- Write your query below
SELECT val FROM T WHERE val IS NULL;

subject: DBMS

setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (1), (NULL);

subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (0), (2), (4);

setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (1), (2), (3);

subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (NULL);

SELECT CAST('1' AS INT);

SELECT ROUND(1.5);

-- Write your query below
SELECT ABS(-1);

SELECT LOWER('A');

subject: DBMS

-- Write your query below
SELECT LENGTH('A');

title: Max
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (1), (2);

title: Transaction Commit
subject: DBMS
description: Begin transaction, update balance, commit. Select balance.
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS account; CREATE TABLE account (bal INT); INSERT INTO account VALUES (50);

title: Transaction Rollback
subject: DBMS
description: Begin, update balance, rollback. Select balance.
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS account; CREATE TABLE account (bal INT); INSERT INTO account VALUES (50);

title: Savepoint
subject: DBMS
description: Begin, insert 1, savepoint S, insert 2, rollback to S, commit. Select *.
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT);

title: Insert Trigger
subject: DBMS
description: Create trigger to log inserts. Insert 1. Select log.
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; DROP TABLE IF EXISTS Log; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); CREATE TABLE Log (val INT);

title: Update Trigger
subject: DBMS
description: Create trigger to log updates (old val). Update 1 to 2. Select log.
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; DROP TABLE IF EXISTS Log; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (1); CREATE TABLE Log (val INT);

title: Delete Trigger
subject: DBMS
description: Create trigger to prevent deletion (raise error). Try delete (ignore error). Select count.
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (1);

title: Updatable View
subject: DBMS
description: Create view V on T. Update V. Select T.
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (1);

title: Unique Index
subject: DBMS
description: Create unique index on T(val). Try insert duplicate (ignore error). Select count.
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (1);

title: Window LAG
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (1), (2);

title: Window LEAD
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (1), (2);

title: Window SUM
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (1), (2);

title: Window AVG
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val REAL); INSERT INTO T VALUES (1), (2);

title: Explain Query
subject: DBMS
description: Explain select * from T. (Mocked output check).
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT);

title: Analyze
subject: DBMS
starterCode:
-- Write your query below
ANALYZE T;
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT);

-- Write your query below
PRAGMA user_version;

title: Table Info
subject: DBMS

-- Write your query below
PRAGMA table_info(T);
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT);

title: Index List
subject: DBMS
starterCode:
-- Write your query below
PRAGMA index_list(T);
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); CREATE INDEX idx ON T(val);

title: Index Info
subject: DBMS
starterCode:
-- Write your query below
PRAGMA index_info(idx);
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); CREATE INDEX idx ON T(val);

title: Case Insensitive Like
subject: DBMS

-- Write your query below
SELECT 'a' LIKE 'A';

subject: DBMS
starterCode:
-- Write your query below
SELECT json_extract('{"a":1}', '$.a');

starterCode:

title: JSON Object

title: Upsert
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (id INT PRIMARY KEY, val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (1, 1);

title: Returning Clause
subject: DBMS
starterCode:
-- Write your query below
INSERT INTO T VALUES (1) RETURNING id;
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (id INT);

title: Generated Column
subject: DBMS
description: Create table with generated column b = a*2. Insert 1. Select b.
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (a INT, b INT GENERATED ALWAYS AS (a*2));

title: Filter Clause
subject: DBMS
starterCode:
-- Write your query below
SELECT count(*) FILTER (WHERE val > 1) FROM T;
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (1), (2);

title: Order Nulls First
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (1), (NULL);

title: Order Nulls Last
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT); INSERT INTO T VALUES (NULL), (1);

title: Drop View
subject: DBMS
starterCode:
-- Write your query below
DROP VIEW V;
setupCode: DROP VIEW IF EXISTS V; CREATE VIEW V AS SELECT 1;

title: Reindex
subject: DBMS
starterCode:
-- Write your query below
REINDEX T;
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT);

title: Strict Table
subject: DBMS
description: Create strict table T. Insert 1. Select *.
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT) STRICT;

title: Without RowID
subject: DBMS
description: Create table without rowid. Insert 1. Select *.
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (val INT PRIMARY KEY) WITHOUT ROWID;

subject: DBMS
description: Select student name and course name using INNER JOIN.

title: Left Join
subject: DBMS
description: Select all students and their courses (if any) using LEFT JOIN.

title: Right Join
subject: DBMS
description: Select all courses and their students (if any) using RIGHT JOIN (Simulated with LEFT JOIN swapping tables as SQLite doesn't support RIGHT JOIN directly, but for standard SQL it's RIGHT JOIN. Here use LEFT JOIN courses).

title: Full Join
subject: DBMS
description: Select all students and courses matching or not. (Simulate FULL JOIN with UNION of LEFT Joins).

title: Cross Join
subject: DBMS
description: Select Cartesian product of students and courses.

title: Self Join

description: Select pairs of students from same city.

title: Correlated Subquery
subject: DBMS

setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS students; CREATE TABLE students (name TEXT, city TEXT, score INT);
INSERT INTO students VALUES ('Alice', 'NY', 40), ('Bob', 'NY', 60), ('Charlie', 'LA', 30);
hint: WHERE score > (SELECT AVG(score) FROM students s2 WHERE s1.city = s2.city)

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS students; CREATE TABLE students (name TEXT, score INT);
INSERT INTO students VALUES ('Alice', 40), ('Bob', 60);

title: Window DENSE_RANK
subject: DBMS
description: Dense Rank students by score desc.
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS students; CREATE TABLE students (name TEXT, score INT);
INSERT INTO students VALUES ('Alice', 60), ('Bob', 60), ('Charlie', 40);

title: Window ROW_NUMBER
subject: DBMS
description: Row number students by score desc.
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS students; CREATE TABLE students (name TEXT, score INT);
INSERT INTO students VALUES ('Alice', 60), ('Bob', 60);

title: Partition By
subject: DBMS
description: Rank students within city by score desc.
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS students; CREATE TABLE students (name TEXT, city TEXT, score INT);
INSERT INTO students VALUES ('Alice', 'NY', 40), ('Bob', 'NY', 60), ('Charlie', 'LA', 50);

title: Case When in Select
subject: DBMS
description: Select name and 'Pass' if score >= 50 else 'Fail'.
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS students; CREATE TABLE students (name TEXT, score INT);
INSERT INTO students VALUES ('Alice', 40), ('Bob', 60);

title: NULLIF
subject: DBMS
description: Select NULLIF(score, 0). (Returns NULL if score is 0).
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS students; CREATE TABLE students (score INT);
INSERT INTO students VALUES (0), (10);

title: Transaction
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (A INT);

title: Rollback
subject: DBMS
description: Begin transaction, insert 1, rollback. Select *. (Should be empty).
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (A INT);

title: Savepoint
subject: DBMS
description: Begin, insert 1, savepoint S, insert 2, rollback to S, commit. Select *. (Should be 1).
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (A INT);

title: Create Index
subject: DBMS
setupCode: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS students; CREATE TABLE students (name TEXT);

title: Drop Index
subject: DBMS
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS students; CREATE TABLE students (name TEXT);
CREATE INDEX idx_name ON students(name);

title: Unique Constraint
subject: DBMS
description: Create table T with unique col A. Try inserting duplicate (ignore error). Select *.

title: Check Constraint
subject: DBMS
description: Create table T with check A > 0. Insert 1. Select *.

title: Default Constraint
subject: DBMS
description: Create table T with default A=1. Insert default. Select *.

title: Not Null Constraint
subject: DBMS
description: Create table T with A INT NOT NULL. Insert 1. Select *.

title: Primary Key
subject: DBMS
description: Create table T with id INT PRIMARY KEY. Insert 1. Select *.

title: Foreign Key
subject: DBMS
description: Create table P (id PK) and C (pid FK). Insert 1 to P, 1 to C. Select *.

title: Trigger
subject: DBMS
description: Create trigger to log insert on T. Insert 1. Select log.
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; DROP TABLE IF EXISTS Log; CREATE TABLE T (A INT);
CREATE TABLE Log (A INT);

title: Drop Trigger
subject: DBMS
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS T; CREATE TABLE T (A INT);
CREATE TRIGGER tr AFTER INSERT ON T BEGIN INSERT INTO T VALUES (1); END;

title: GLOB Operator
subject: DBMS
description: Select names starting with 'A' using GLOB.
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS students; CREATE TABLE students (name TEXT);
INSERT INTO students VALUES ('Alice'), ('Bob');

title: Replace String
subject: DBMS
setupCode:
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS students; CREATE TABLE students (name TEXT);
INSERT INTO students VALUES ('Alice');

title: Trim String

title: Changes

SELECT changes();

title: Total Changes

SELECT total_changes();

title: IFNULL
subject: DBMS
starterCode:

subject: DBMS

title: Likelihood
subject: SQL
starterCode:
